{{cpp/ranges/drop_while_view/title|pred}}
{{cpp/ranges/drop_while_view/navbar}}

{{ddcl|since=c++20|
constexpr const Pred&amp; pred() const;
}}

Returns a reference to the stored predicate.

If {{c|*this}} does not store a predicate (e.g. an exception is thrown on the assignment to {{c|*this}}, which copy-constructs or move-constructs a {{tt|Pred}}), the behavior is undefined.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
A reference to the stored predicate {{rlpi|/#Data members|pred_}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;array&gt;
#include &lt;iomanip&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;ranges&gt;

int main()
{
    constexpr std::array data{0, -1, -2, 3, 1, 4, 1, 5};
    
    auto view = std::ranges::drop_while_view
    {
        data, [](int x) { return x &lt;= 0; }
    };

    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha;
    for (int x : data)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "predicate(" &lt;&lt; std::setw(2) &lt;&lt; x &lt;&lt; ") : "
                  &lt;&lt; view.pred()(x) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
predicate( 0) : true
predicate(-1) : true
predicate(-2) : true
predicate( 3) : false
predicate( 1) : false
predicate( 4) : false
predicate( 1) : false
predicate( 5) : false
}}
